cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles south of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, forecast to turn north-northwest then northeast after landfall, tracking across eastern Texas/western Louisiana and north-eastward through Arkansas toward the Tennessee/Ohio Valleys
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas–Louisiana border (southeastern TX or southwestern LA)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from San Luis Pass, TX to the mouth of the Mississippi River (Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Brief increase in winds (gusts 20–30 mph) possible as the weakening remnants pass south of Michigan
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture may bring 1–2 inches of rain to southeastern Michigan late Friday into Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated thunderstorms with localized ponding of water
